private_information: Action paltry takes three object arguments: subject object_0, marker object_1, texture object_2
Preconditions required: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, vase object_0 object_1, next object_1 object_2
Effects: adds next object_0 object_2, deletes vase object_0 object_1
paltry.goal: Contribute a correct, self-contained structured fragment describing paltry preconditions and effects that can be integrated with other fragments.

private_information: Action sip takes three object arguments: subject object_0, marker object_1, texture object_2
Preconditions required: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, next object_0 object_2, next object_1 object_2
Effects: adds vase object_0 object_1, deletes next object_0 object_2
sip.goal: Provide a clear structured fragment describing sip preconditions and effects and note any ambiguous references.

private_information: Action clip takes three object arguments: subject object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2
Preconditions required: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, next object_0 object_2
Effects: adds vase object_0 object_1, deletes next object_0 object_2
clip.goal: Produce a fragment for clip describing preconditions, effects, and naming conventions to avoid aliasing.

private_information: Action wretched takes four object arguments: sneeze-subject object_0, texture object_1, texture object_2, stupendous object_3
Preconditions required: sneeze object_0, texture object_1, texture object_2, stupendous object_3, next object_0 object_1, collect object_1 object_3, collect object_2 object_3
Effects: adds next object_0 object_2, deletes next object_0 object_1
wretched.goal: Deliver a precise fragment for wretched including preconditions and effects, and identify potential temporal interactions with other actions.

private_information: Action memory takes three object arguments: cats object_0, spring object_1, spring object_2
Preconditions required: cats object_0, spring object_1, spring object_2, next object_0 object_1
Effects: adds next object_0 object_2, deletes next object_0 object_1
memory.goal: Return a structured fragment for memory that highlights ordering constraints implied by its effects.

private_information: Action tightfisted takes three object arguments: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2
Preconditions required: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, vase object_0 object_1
Effects: adds next object_0 object_2, deletes vase object_0 object_1
tightfisted.goal: Produce a model fragment for tightfisted and point out where it overlaps or conflicts with paltry, sip, and clip.

private_information: Role: audit temporal and causal consistency across model fragments
Responsibilities: detect bookkeeping shortcuts like implicit tokens or post-hoc penalties, remove or flag them, and propose normalized predicates and invariant constraints
Capability: aggregate fragment outputs and produce a cleaned, causally consistent fragment set
auditor.goal: Audit incoming model fragments for causal and temporal consistency, remove bookkeeping shortcuts, and emit cleaned fragments and a succinct audit report.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the cleaned fragments from all agents and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem tailored to the FastDownwards solver that achieves the global goal next object_10 object_7, next object_11 object_7, and next object_12 object_7.

public_information: Available actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted. Each action manipulates predicates such as hand, cats, texture, vase, next, collect, sneeze, spring, stupendous.
Two different statement blocks were supplied with initial facts and alternative goal formulations. The final target goal is next object_10 object_7, next object_11 object_7, next object_12 object_7.

Initial statements include many ground facts such as cats object_0, cats object_1, collects, various hand facts, next relations, sneeze facts, spring facts, stupendous facts, and texture facts. Agents should assume object identifiers object_0 through object_12 exist.
Modeling must avoid relying on bookkeeping shortcuts such as tokens, quotas, or post-hoc penalties; temporal and causal consistency must be explicit.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an expert action modeler. Produce a structured, machine-friendly fragment that lists the action signature, explicit preconditions, explicit add effects, explicit delete effects, any conditional effects if present, and a list of uncertainties or naming ambiguities. Do not emit PDDL. Do not assume objects beyond those mentioned in your private information.
analyze.prompt: Agent paltry: Use public information {environment->public_information} and your private knowledge {agents->paltry->private_information} to produce a fragment describing paltry. Express preconditions and effects as lists of ground predicate templates with placeholders. List any assumptions you make and any potential conflicts with other actions.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an expert action modeler. Produce a structured fragment that lists signature, preconditions, add effects, delete effects, and any ambiguous references. Do not output PDDL.
analyze.prompt: Agent sip: Using public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->sip->private_information}, produce a machine-friendly fragment for sip and identify naming overlaps and ordering implications.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an expert action modeler. Provide a fragment enumerating the action interface, explicit preconditions, add effects, delete effects, and possible concurrency constraints. Avoid PDDL generation.
analyze.prompt: Agent clip: Based on public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->clip->private_information}, return a structured fragment for clip and highlight predicates that may alias with other actions.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an expert action modeler. Provide a fragment that captures signature, required preconditions, add and delete effects, any required concurrent collects, and potential ordering constraints. Do not produce PDDL.
analyze.prompt: Agent wretched: With public context {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->wretched->private_information}, emit a structured fragment for wretched and call out temporal interactions.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an expert action modeler. Produce a concise fragment listing signature, preconditions, add effects, delete effects and note any implicit temporal requirements. Do not create PDDL.
analyze.prompt: Agent memory: Use {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->memory->private_information} to produce a structured fragment and flag any dependencies on next relations.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an expert action modeler. Provide a fragment with action signature, preconditions, add effects, delete effects, and note overlaps with vase-related preconditions. Avoid generating PDDL.
analyze.prompt: Agent tightfisted: Considering public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->tightfisted->private_information}, produce a structured fragment and highlight conflicts with paltry and sip.

audit.system_prompt: You are a specialist in temporal and causal model validation. Your job is to consume action fragments, detect implicit bookkeeping shortcuts, remove or normalize them, produce a cleaned set of fragments (in the same structured format) and a short audit report describing fixes applied. The cleaned fragments should be explicit about temporal ordering and invariants and avoid tokens or post-hoc penalties. Do not emit PDDL.
audit.prompt: Auditor: Receive fragments {input}. Using {environment->public_information} and your private role description {agents->auditor->private_information}, produce a cleaned_fragments object plus a concise audit report. Explicitly list any normalization steps such as splitting combined predicates, renaming aliases, and converting implicit tokens into explicit predicates with clear preconditions and effects.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator responsible for integrating cleaned action fragments and producing a PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver. Keep agent actions distinct by prefixing action names with the agent name. The PDDL output must include a domain and a problem. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target FastDownwards compatibility: avoid nonstandard PDDL extensions, use STRIPS and typed predicates if useful, and include required object declarations, initial state, and goal. Resolve naming ambiguities conservatively and document any remaining assumptions in comments inside the PDDL problem file.
pddl.prompt: Orchestrator: Integrate fragments and the audit output {audit_report} with public information {environment->public_information} and agents' goals {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Produce a final PDDL domain and a final PDDL problem that achieves next object_10 object_7, next object_11 object_7, and next object_12 object_7. Ensure actions from different agents remain distinguishable. Enclose domain in <domain></domain> and problem in <problem></problem>.
